body.p: As clerk of the Kenton County Court I was called on By B H Elleston to Know if his License as Tavern Keeper in Covington, whether he was in default he was then quite unwill this took place at Latonia Springs where he was then Staying for the Benefit of his health in the fall of 1860 I told him that they were not out but that they would Expire in Nov 1860 he then with much difficulty on ac of his bad health come to court and received them he then he was then quite unwell and requested me to let him Know when they would Expire which I promised to do, but time passed on rapidly and I forgot to in form him his Lisence Expired last Nov 1861. And have not been renewed untill this March Term of the Kenton County Court I am fully satisfied that the said Elleston would have renewed theirs if he had known the were out as I know he has allways as I believe tried to do his duty as a Tavern Keeper.

S. C Perrin Clk
Kenton County Court

Covington City Ct
S. C Perrins Statement
